intro: Solanum xanti var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and smooth, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its fruit is a globose berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
